short_description: Discover Brunei, a small but wealthy Southeast Asian nation on the island of Borneo. Experience rich Islamic culture, explore pristine rainforests, visit the magnificent Sultan Omar Ali Saifuddien Mosque, and immerse yourself in the unique blend of traditional and modern Brunei.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink - Brunei has excellent water quality
alcohol_info: Alcohol is prohibited in Brunei due to Islamic law
Non-Muslims over 17 years old may import limited amounts for personal consumption
Public consumption of alcohol is strictly prohibited

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: Tipping is not customary, though service charge may be included
tipping.taxis: Tipping is not expected but rounding up is appreciated

weather.title: Brunei has a tropical equatorial climate with high humidity and consistent warm temperatures year-round. The country experiences two monsoon seasons: the northeast monsoon from December to March and the southwest monsoon from June to September, with heavy rainfall throughout the year.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.time_period: March to May, September to November
when_to_visit.short_description: Relatively drier periods with less rainfall, making this the best time to visit. Perfect for exploring cities, visiting mosques, and outdoor activities. Ideal weather for sightseeing and cultural experiences

when_to_visit.title: Monsoon Season
when_to_visit.time_period: December to February, June to August
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall and high humidity during monsoon periods. Still possible to visit, but be prepared for frequent rain showers. Lush green landscapes and fewer tourists

when_to_visit.title: Cultural Visits
when_to_visit.short_description: Brunei can be visited year-round for cultural experiences. The weather is consistently warm, and indoor attractions like mosques and museums are accessible regardless of rain

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Brunei is during the relatively drier periods from March to May and September to November when rainfall is lower, making it ideal for exploring cities, visiting mosques, and outdoor activities
